intro.description: Match Analysis analyzes duplicates and similar records in a data set. It helps you define Match Rules that can be used in analyses or in match components.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata.
item.description: To open the Create New Analysis wizard, right click Analyses in the DQ Repository tree view and select New Analysis . Type "Match" in the filter field, and then select Match Analysis from the analysis list. A wizard prompts you to provide the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description...). Upon completion, an editor opens in which you can modify the analysis metadata and define the analysis settings.

item.title: Connect to a data source
item.description:
Create the connection to the data source you want to analyze. If you have already defined some metadata that you want to reuse, just skip this step.
To create a metadata connection from within the editor, you can click on the New Connection button in the Match Analysis editor.
You can also right-click on the subfolders of the Metadata folder in the DQ Repository tree view. In this step, you will be invited to select the columns to analyze.

item.title: Select data to analyze
item.description: If you have already selected the data to analyze in the previous step, you may skip this step. In the match editor, click the "Select Data" button. Then browse and select the columns to analyze. In the Limit field, set the number of the data records you want to use as a data sample on which to test the match rule.

item.title: Generate a blocking key
item.description:
Select the columns that will be used to generate a blocking key. A blocking key is required when you have a lot of data to analyze. In the Data view, click on the Select Blocking Key tab and click the column header in the data table. This will add the columns to the blocking key table. You need to click at Select Blocking Key again to finish the selection.
The next step is to specify how to generate the key (choose characters to extract, algorithms to apply on the column, etc). The concatenation of the results of the algorithms will generate a key.
When complete, click Chart to compute the key on the data sample and show the results in a chart. The chart shows how data are partitioned. It is recommended to have the size of the partition as small as possible (the horizontal coordinate).

item.title: Define the Match Rule
item.description:
In the match editor, click the "Select Matching Key" button. Then click the column header in the data table. Select all attributes required to the match operation the same way. In the Matching Key table, choose the algorithms you want to apply to the comparison ( Matching Function ) and the other match parameters.
When done, you can visualize the result of the configuration applied to the data sample by clicking on the Chart button. Repeat this step until the configuration is satisfying.

item.title: Export the Match Rule
item.description: Once you test the Match Rule on the sample data and see that it correctly identifies duplicates, you can export it by using the export icon on the toolbar of the match editor then it will show as a Match Rule item in the DQ Repository. You can use the exported Match Rule in other analyses or in Data Quality matching components.

item.title: Analyze
item.description: Click the Run icon on the match editor toolbar to execute the analysis on the whole data set. The match editor switches to the Analysis Results view showing the matching results on your data.
